transcript.title: STATEMENT BY THE PRIME MINISTER THE HON PJ KEATING MP, SOUTH AFRICA: INAUGRATION OF PRESIDENT MANDELA
transcript.content:
7
PRIME MINISTER 41/ 94
STATEMENT BY THE PRIME MINISTER, THE HON P. J. KEATING MP.
SOUTH AFRICA: INAUGURATION OF PRESIDENT MANDELA
Australians join wholeheartedly with South Africans in celebrating the
inauguration of President Mandela. It is a great moment for South Africa but
also for the world.
Australia is represented at the inauguration by former Prime Ministers Hawke
and Fraser, each of whom helped to put Australia in the front ranks of the
international community in the long struggle, which culminates today, for a
non-racial and democratic government in South Africa.
We look now to the full restoration of a strong and close relationship between
Australia and South Africa. As part of that process Senator Evans and
Mr Bilney have announced today a new program of assistance amounting to
million over three years.
I have written to President Mandela congratulating him on the election result
and assuring him of the warmest possible welcome if he is able to visit
Australia again in his new capacity.
CANBERRA MAY 1994
